thread.title: Injured man winched 80ft from Worcester Cathedral bell tower
thread.title_full: Injured man winched 80ft from Worcester Cathedral bell tower

title: Injured man winched 80ft from Worcester Cathedral bell tower
text:
Injured man winched 80ft from Worcester Cathedral bell tower 12 February 2017 Image copyright H and W Fire Service Image caption The injured man is thought to have been a visiting bell ringer A man had to be lowered 80ft (24m) to safety after falling and injuring himself in a bell tower. 
Dramatic pictures show the man being brought to the ground at Worcester Cathedral by a specialist rope rescue unit. 
The fall happened during Evensong at the cathedral on Saturday. He was taken to hospital after being lowered down into the cathedral. 
He is thought to have suffered a head wound and possible back injury when his foot got caught in a rope. 
Mark Regan, ringing master at the cathedral, told the Worcester News it had been a "freak accident". 
"He went up in the air a couple of feet and landed awkwardly," he said. Image copyright H and W Fire Service Image caption The injured man was lowered to safety by a specialist rope rescue unit Image copyright H and W Fire and Rescue Image caption Pictures posted by the fire service show the man being brought to the ground Image copyright H and W Fire and Rescue Image caption Group commander Grant Wills said it was a technical and challenging job Image copyright H and W Fire Service Image caption The injured man was taken to hospital after his ordeal at the cathedral
